title: Add automatic grokking phase transition detection
description:
Training runs for many epochs but grokking occurs around STEP 7,000 (~epoch 700). Need automatic detection of the phase transition to:
- Alert when grokking occurs
- Save checkpoint at the critical moment
- Log detailed statistics

CRITICAL TIMELINE (steps vs epochs):
- Steps per epoch: ~10 (5,108 examples ÷ 512 batch size)
- Step 0-1,000 (~Epoch 0-100): Memorization phase
- Step 1,000-7,000 (~Epoch 100-700): Plateau phase
- Step ~7,000 (~Epoch ~700): GROKKING POINT ← detect here!
- Step 7,000+ (~Epoch 700+): Post-grok solidification

Detection criteria (from NOTES.md Section 2.1):
- Validation accuracy spike: >20% increase within 500 steps
- Validation loss drop: >50% decrease from plateau baseline
- Occurs after prolonged plateau (train loss ~0, val loss high)

Implementation:
- Track rolling window of val metrics (step-based, not epoch-based)
- Detect sudden change vs. plateau baseline  
- Log 'GROKKING DETECTED at step X (epoch Y)'
- Auto-save checkpoint with 'grok_step_X' label
- Export analysis data for verification

Location: src/verify.rs:20-232 (GrokkingPhaseReport exists), src/main.rs (integration)
Reference: NOTES.md Section 2.1, lines 94 and 137 (refers to 'step 7,000')
close_reason: Implemented automatic grokking phase transition detection with rolling window analysis. Detection uses configurable thresholds (20% acc jump, 500-step window, >1000 step minimum) to identify the characteristic sudden spike from plateau (~1%) to high accuracy (>90%). Integrated into post-training analysis with detailed logging, automatic checkpoint saving, and fallback detection. Added 3 comprehensive unit tests. All 59 tests passing.

title: Integrate Restricted/Excluded Loss metrics into training loop
description:
The codebase has implemented Restricted Loss and Excluded Loss analysis (src/analysis.rs:137-383) but these metrics are not tracked during training. These are critical 'Geiger counters' for detecting internal restructuring before grokking occurs.

CRITICAL TIMELINE:
- Grokking occurs at step ~7,000 (~epoch 700)
- Steps per epoch: ~10
- Need to track these metrics starting early to catch the transition

Implementation needed:
- Add Restricted Loss computation every 50-100 epochs (500-1000 steps)
- Add Excluded Loss computation every 50-100 epochs
- Track and log both metrics alongside train/val loss
- **Key prediction**: Restricted Loss should drop BEFORE test loss drops (around step 5,000-6,000)
- **Key prediction**: Excluded Loss should spike as grokking approaches (step 6,000-7,000)

These metrics detect the phase transition ~1,000 steps BEFORE validation accuracy spikes!

Computation frequency:
- Early phase (epoch 0-500): every 100 epochs
- Critical phase (epoch 500-1,000): every 50 epochs  
- Post-grok (epoch 1,000+): every 200 epochs

title: Track weight norm evolution throughout training
description:
Weight decay (1.0) drives the transition from high-norm memorization to low-norm generalization. Need to track weight norms to verify this mechanism.

CRITICAL TIMELINE:
- Step 0-1,000 (~Epoch 0-100): High norm (memorization circuit)
- Step 1,000-7,000 (~Epoch 100-700): Gradual norm decay during plateau
- Step ~7,000 (~Epoch ~700): Sharp norm drop at grokking
- Step 7,000+ (~Epoch 700+): Low norm stabilization (generalizing circuit)

Implementation (infrastructure exists but unused):
- Compute model L2 norm every 50 epochs (~500 steps)
- Track per-layer weight norms
- Log norm reduction over time
- Verify norm decreases during plateau phase (epoch 100-700)
- Should see sharp norm drop at grokking point (epoch ~700, step ~7k)
- Save norm history to artifacts/weight_norms.json

The theory (NOTES.md Section 2.2):
- Memorization circuit: high weight magnitudes (early training)
- Generalizing circuit: low weight norms (post-grok)
- Weight decay pressure favors efficiency
- Norm decay is the ENGINE of grokking

Expected pattern:
- Epoch 0-100: Norm increases (building memorization)
- Epoch 100-700: Norm gradually decreases (weight decay erosion)
- Epoch ~700: Sudden norm drop (circuit switch)
- Epoch 700+: Norm stabilizes at low value

title: VERIFICATION: Core implementation is 100% specification-compliant
description:
Comprehensive verification against NOTES.md specification completed on 2026-01-07.

VERDICT: ✅ SPECIFICATION COMPLIANT

Core Implementation - 100% Match:
✅ Dataset: modulus=113, train_fraction=0.4 (30-50% range), full 12,769 sample space
✅ Model: 1-layer, d_model=128, n_heads=4, d_ff=512, ReLU, no LayerNorm, learned pos emb
✅ Optimizer: AdamW with β=(0.9,0.98), lr=1e-3, weight_decay=1.0 (CRITICAL)
✅ Training: batch_size=512, seed=42
✅ Causal masking, bias terms enabled, decoder-only architecture

CRITICAL CORRECTION - Steps vs Epochs:
- Steps per epoch: ~10 (5,108 examples ÷ 512 batch)
- NOTES.md refers to 'step 7,000' NOT epoch 7,000!
- Expected grokking: **step ~7,000 = epoch ~700**
- Default 20k epochs = 200k steps (WAY too long!)
- Recommended: **2,000-3,000 epochs** = 20k-30k steps

Expected Behavior (CORRECTED TIMELINE):
- Phase 1 (step 0-1k, epoch 0-100): Train acc→100%, val acc→1% (memorization)
- Phase 2 (step 1k-7k, epoch 100-700): Plateau - metrics frozen, internal shift  
- Phase 3 (step ~7k, epoch ~700): GROK - val acc: 1%→90%+ in ~500 steps

Why This Should Grok:
1. Data starvation (40%) forces algorithm search vs memorization
2. High weight decay (1.0) drives low-norm solution preference  
3. Single layer enables clean circuit analysis
4. ReLU allows mathematical derivation
5. No LayerNorm preserves additive decomposition
6. Sufficient patience (recommended 2-3k epochs gives 20-30k steps, grok expected at 7k)

title: Validate grokking robustness with weight decay sweep
description:
NOTES.md Section 3.3 states 'If grokking fails, increase this value [weight decay]'. Need empirical validation of sensitivity.

Experiment design:
- Baseline: weight_decay = 1.0 (current)
- Lower: weight_decay = 0.5 (should delay or prevent grokking)
- Higher: weight_decay = 2.0 (should accelerate grokking)
- Control: different random seeds (42, 123, 456)

Success criteria:
- All runs with WD=1.0 should grok by epoch 10k
- WD=0.5 may fail to grok by epoch 20k
- WD=2.0 should grok earlier (~epoch 5k)

Implementation:
- Create sweep_weight_decay.sh script
- Run 3 seeds × 3 WD values = 9 total runs
- Log grok epoch for each run
- Generate comparison plots
- Document findings

This is LOW PRIORITY - only run after confirming baseline groks.
Estimated compute: 9 runs × 10-15 hours = 90-135 GPU hours
